caption: One of the best spots to capture the beauty of the effiel tower. Open space with perhaps the city's best views of the Eiffel Tower because of its high altitude. Many street vendors offer souvenirs.

From here there is a beautiful view of the Eiffel Tower. Simply fantastic.. üòç In the evening it is very beautiful, and the atmosphere is lively, as the locals gather and sing together. At Trocadero you have two stands with snacks (sandwiches, pancakes..).

The awesome view point to watch Eiffel tower beauty from here. Too much crowd and keep your belongings safe. Remember to bring heart balloons from home. It will be cheaper and you can take nice pictures. Remember to come to this place at very odd timings.

You can get beautiful views of the Eiffel Tower from here. This place used to be beautifully laid out but now looks a bit like a construction site. Work is going on I guess following the 2024 olympics. Nevertheless, it is a cool place to visit and to take in views and pictures of the Eiffel Tower which is situated not far from there. There‚Äôs a metro station near the plaza. It can get crowded but that‚Äôs normal these days at popular attractions sites.

Place du Trocad√©ro is one of the best spots in Paris for capturing stunning photos of the Eiffel Tower! The elevated position offers a perfect vantage point, especially during golden hour or at night when the tower is illuminated. The fountains and gardens add a beautiful foreground to your shots, making it a favorite for photographers and Instagrammers alike. The atmosphere is lively, with street performers and plenty of space to relax and enjoy the view. Just be mindful of your belongings, as it can get crowded. Whether you're a professional photographer or just looking for that perfect Parisian snapshot, Place du Trocad√©ro is a must-visit location!

It is a fantastic view and worth a visit on your way from the cafe, of which there are a few in the circle, over the bridge to the Eiffel tower. This is also close to the museum of architecture. there is also a train station entrance close by.

The Eiffel Tower, a symbol of Paris and France, stands tall as an iconic feat of engineering and architecture. Its intricate latticework and soaring height offer breathtaking views of the city and beyond. Lovely atmosphere üëå üòç I fallen ‚ù§Ô∏è Paris see you soon üòä

One of the most famous and picturesque spots to capture breathtaking photos of the Eiffel Tower. With its unobstructed view and perfect vantage point, it‚Äôs a favorite for tourists and photographers worldwide. Whether you visit during the early morning sunrise or in the evening when the tower is illuminated, this location offers a perfect backdrop for memorable photos.  However, since it‚Äôs a popular tourist destination, it tends to get very crowded, especially during peak times like sunrise and sunset. Additionally, be cautious of pickpockets and scammers, as there have been frequent reports of theft and fraud in this area. Keep your belongings secure and be wary of strangers who approach you for conversations or offers.

The Eiffel Tower is an absolute must-visit every time I come to Paris! No matter how many times I‚Äôve seen it, its beauty and grandeur never fail to amaze me. Whether it‚Äôs during the day with the stunning views of the city or at night when it sparkles, the experience is always magical.  I love taking a stroll around the Champ de Mars and enjoying a coffee with a view of this iconic landmark. It‚Äôs a place that captures the true essence of Paris, blending history, architecture, and romance all in one.  Visiting the Eiffel Tower has become a tradition for me‚Äîit‚Äôs simply impossible to visit Paris without stopping by!
Such a beautiful view of Eiffel Tower, very nice atmosphere, with musicians playing live music

Best views of the Eiffel Tower! I didn't plan on going to any of the museums here and am kind of bummed we didn't get to see them. So if you are planning a trip - be sure to research this spot because there is a ton to see and do. There was a lot of construction due to prep for the Olympics but we were still able to see everything.

One of the best places to take pictures of the Eiffel Tower in Paris. I had the chance to stay around during New Years Eve and there were a lot of people here, you couldn't walk, but it was worth it.  Be sure not to visit this place during big holidays if you don't like to see a lot of people, because normally it's full. Enjoy your time here.
Great place to view the Eifel tower. Built to welcome guests with the best welcome view. This place is near to some of the other attractions in the city as well. Worth visiting.

Paris Mon Amour. As a song says. Here I am again - Me voil√† de retour. I regret nothing, love comes and goes - Je ne regrette rien, non L'amour √ßa va, √ßa vient. This is a love story between us - C'est une histoire d'amour entre nous. There is an infinite amount to say about Paris. It is not called the 'City of Love' for nothing. Anyone who has been there once will long to return to this city again and again. It is the atmosphere, the language, the sounds and the smells, especially when you can stay there as a couple. I feel the same way.. I got there twice by plane and once by train. It took about 1 1/2 hours from Munich to Paris. A good 8 hours by train. I was able to stay in this city as a guest for a week each time. We crossed the city on foot. There are cafes on every street corner all of which invite you to linger. There are many small hotels to stay in, which may not have the comfort of the big hotels, but are typical of France, small, cozy and clean. I am an atheist but Sacr√©-C≈ìur de Montmartre has always been a sacred and magical place that should be approached with respectful silence and respectful quietness. Friends were there in the middle of the month and provided me with the pictures. Paris is definitely worth a trip, no, several times. Don't miss out on this city! Be sure to visit Versailles, about 20 km west of Paris. I don't want to upload any more pictures of Paris, there are enough of them, I just want to give an impression. Find me on You Tube too.

No doubt this square has the best view for the Eiffel Tower!.  Can get busy and has many sellers who would do anything including taking pictures for you to sell their goods.  There are some food outlets there (did not try).  A fun place to hang out when visiting Paris.

Place du Trocad√©ro in Paris offers one of the best vantage points for viewing the Eiffel Tower, with its spacious terrace and gardens. It's a popular spot for tourists and locals alike, known for its striking architecture, lively atmosphere, and stunning photo opportunities. A perfect place for a relaxed stroll with a breathtaking Parisian backdrop.

Passed by a group of handsome hunky police men so keep an eye out Recommend to start here when making your way to Eiffel Tower, it‚Äôs such a beautiful walk when you walk down past the lush green garden

You win some, you lose some, the best views hands down of the Eiffel Tower especially with the iconic Olympic Rings. Although there was some construction gates covering it, we could all peer in with our phones and get the shot and my goodness what a shot!!
A great place to view the Eiffel Tower. Com early in the morning to avoid the crowd  it is easily accessible by metro.
Great views of the Eiffel Tower, especially at night! A calm and hushed energy from the crowd when the lights go on! Thrilling to be there. Highly recommend it!

It was a great place to see the Eiffel Tower because of the elevated position. This makes it a very popular location.  The square and esplanade have a lot to offer with trees to sit under on the sides, which is nice on a warm day.  Interesting and pleasant water features and statues.

This is THE spot for photos of the tower. You will only want to take them here. Perfect view at all times of the day and even though there are a lot of people you can still get a clear shot. There are a lot of benches to stop and rest along the way, steps to sit on, take photos and relax. Water fountains, benches, park for dogs, vendors, cafe and restaurants across the street and just amazing views. I would recommend starting here first and walking down if you have anyone with you hard of walking. The street side has a perfect drop off spot and you can walk down and enjoy the park walk down to the fountain.
A little crowded but good place, best view of Eiffel Tower

A great place to see the entire Eiffel Tower. It's quite noisy so it won't be suitable for people who like quiet. Overall pretty good. You should come here in the evening, it will be great to see the Eiffel Tower light up..

We did not actually go up the tower, just walked around, enjoyed the views, people watched, and walked on. Very walkable area, something I enjoyed about Paris in general. The line to the tower looked very long. I think you can do tickets in advance and probably a good idea to look into to avoid spending your entire day in lines.

No better place to take in the iconic view that is the Eiffel Tower....can get a bit busy for the towers first 'sparkle' of the night, so get there sharp if you want a good spot for photographs. Some nice restaurants are just beyond it... We loved our night here....
It has a great view of the Eiffel Tower and has multiple locations to take photo

The best viewpoint in Paris that covers the Eiffel tower and the fountains in full. It's pretty central and easy to access by public transport. It's quite busy with everyone taking the photo op but it's completely worth it as the view is amazing!
Best place to visit the Eiffel tower. I loved the view at night.
Awesome view of the Eiffel Tower. However can get a little crowded
Love the sight of eiffel tower from here

It's a great look out over Paris but more so the Eiffel tower. It is usually very busy but that is because of the quality of the photos you can take. It is most definitely a place that you must visit and take a picture there if you get the chance.

One of the best place to view Eiffel tower. The place is so busy around the clock. Lots of people, vendors and hawkers selling souvenirs and toys.  At night, while waiting for the Eiffel tower to light up, there are musicians playing and singing. Like a mini concert but the gig is so cool. The ambience is better with those musicians and singers filling the air with their good music. There is a museum in the area, the steps are used by visitors to sit down while chilling.

Great views of the Eiffel Tower. Lots of Africans offering to take your picture but don‚Äôt engage with them. They‚Äôll take your money and have no fear. They say ‚Ç¨1 Eiffel Tower but you ask them for fun and then the price is ‚Ç¨5 don‚Äôt engage them as they look like they‚Äôll scam you.

Best to come here early as it can get flooded with tourists. But perfect spot to get get photos with the eiffel tower. I wouldn't bother walking down to the eiffel tower atm because everything is shut off due to the olympics. There is also free wifi thats quite steady but probably stand closer to the vuildings to latch onto it.

Very nice place where you can take spectacular photos of Eiffel tower. Cantinas were located around the place but those are very overpriced. It tends to get really crowded in the daytime and it is much quieter at night.

It was very busy with visitors/tourist taking pictures or hanging out. You also have vendors out selling their wares. However it was a little dirty with trash, etc. Needs to be power wash every day and picked up.. If I should visit Paris again I hope this problem has been resolved. It was a good visit seeing the Effel Tower but could have been a great visit if the areas leading up to it and all around it throughout the city was trash free.
Some of the best views of the Eiffel Tower!
